skills.name: Recognise direct proportion in the form y = kx² from a table of numbers
Work out missing quantities from direct proportion problems using an equation in the form y = kx²
Complete missing values in tables for variables with the proportional relationship kx³
Form equations in the form y = kx³ from direct proportion scenarios
Complete missing values in tables for variables with the proportional relationship k√x

explanations.A: q is directly proportional to q², meaning we must multiply p² by the same number each time to get q. For each value of p, check what p² has been multiplied by to get q.
explanations.B: This table shows inverse proportion (as p² goes up, q goes down). We want the table where p² is multiplied by the same amount each time to get q.
explanations.C: q is directly proportional to q², meaning we must multiply p² by the same number each time to get q. In this table, when p = 1, p² = 1, then multiply by 6 to get q = 6. When p = 2, p² = 4, then multiply by 6 again to get q = 24.
explanations.D: Careful, q is proportional to p² not just p.

explanations.A: Careful, q is proportional to p² not just p.
explanations.B: q is directly proportional to q², meaning we must multiply p² by the same number each time to get q. In this table, when p = 1, p² = 1, then multiply by 8 to get q = 8. When p = 2, p² = 4, then multiply by 8 again to get q = 32.
explanations.C: q is directly proportional to q², meaning we must multiply p² by the same number each time to get q. For each value of p, check what p² has been multiplied by to get q.
explanations.D: This table shows inverse proportion (as p² goes up, q goes down). We want the table where p² is multiplied by the same amount each time to get q.

explanations.A: d is directly proportional to t², meaning we must multiply t² by the same number each time to get d. What was 4² multiplied by to get 80? Multiply 3² by the same amount.
explanations.B: Careful, d is proportional to t², not just t.
explanations.C: d is directly proportional to t², meaning we must multiply t² by the same number each time to get d. What was 4² multiplied by to get 80? Multiply 3² by the same amount.
explanations.D: d is directly proportional to t², meaning we must multiply t² by the same number each time to get d. In this table, when t = 4, t² = 16, then multiply by 5 to get d = 80. When t = 3, t² = 9, then multiply by 5 again to get d = 45.

explanations.A: d is directly proportional to t², meaning we must multiply t² by the same number each time to get d. In this table, when t = 6, t² = 36, then multiply by 3 to get d = 108. When t = 3, t² = 9, then multiply by 3 again to get d = 27.
explanations.B: Careful, d is proportional to t², not just t.
explanations.C: d is directly proportional to t², meaning we must multiply t² by the same number each time to get d. What was 6² multiplied by to get 108? Multiply 3² by the same amount.
explanations.D: d is directly proportional to t², meaning we must multiply t² by the same number each time to get d. What was 6² multiplied by to get 108? Multiply 3² by the same amount.

explanations.A: q is directly proportional to √p, meaning we must multiply √p by the same thing each time to get q. √9 = 3 and 3 x 2 = 6, so take √25 and multiply by 2. √25 x 2 = 5 x 2 = 10.
explanations.B: Careful, q is proportional to √p, not just p. What was √9 multiplied by to get 6?
explanations.C: q is directly proportional to √p, meaning we must multiply √p by the same number each time to get q. What was √9 multiplied by to get 6? Multiply √25 by the same thing.
explanations.D: q is directly proportional to √p, meaning we must multiply √p by the same number each time to get q. What was √9 multiplied by to get 6? Multiply √25 by the same thing.

explanations.A: q is directly proportional to √p, meaning we must multiply √p by the same number each time to get q. What was √9 multiplied by to get 15? Multiply √36 by the same thing.
explanations.B: q is directly proportional to √p, meaning we must multiply √p by the same thing each time to get q. √9 = 3 and 3 x 5 = 15, so take √36 and multiply by 5. √36 x 5 = 6 x 5 = 30.
explanations.C: Careful, q is proportional to √p, not just p. What was √9 multiplied by to get 15?
explanations.D: q is directly proportional to √p, meaning we must multiply √p by the same number each time to get q. What was √9 multiplied by to get 15? Multiply √36 by the same thing.

explanations.A: q is directly proportional to p³, meaning we must multiply p³ by the same number each time to get q. 2³= 2 x 2 x 2 = 8, then multiply by 2 to get 16. 3³ = 3 x 3 x 3 = 27, then multiply by 2 to get 54.
explanations.B: q is directly proportional to p³, meaning we must multiply p³ by the same number each time to get q. What was 2³ multiplied by to get 16? Multiply 3³ by the same thing.
explanations.C: Careful, q is proportional to p³, not just p. What was 2³ multiplied by to get 16?
explanations.D: q is directly proportional to p³, meaning we must multiply p³ by the same number each time to get q. What was 2³ multiplied by to get 16? Multiply 3³ by the same thing.

explanations.A: Careful, q is proportional to p³, not just p. What was 2³ multiplied by to get 4?
explanations.B: q is directly proportional to p³, meaning we must multiply p³ by the same number each time to get q. What was 2³ multiplied by to get 4? Multiply 4³ by the same thing.
explanations.C: q is directly proportional to p³, meaning we must multiply p³ by the same number each time to get q. 2³ = 2 x 2 x 2 = 8, and multiply by 1/2 to get 4. 4³ = 4 x 4 x 4 = 64 and multiply by 1/2 to get 32.
explanations.D: q is directly proportional to p³, meaning we must multiply p³ by the same number each time to get q. What was 2³ multiplied by to get 4? Multiply 4³ by the same thing.

explanations.A: d is directly proportional to t³, but to complete the equation you need to calculate what t³ is multiplied by to get d. What is 6³ multiplied by to get 1512?
explanations.B: d is directly proportional to t³, not just t, so what is 6³ multiplied by to get 1512?
explanations.C: d is directly proportional to t³, so what is 6³ multiplied by to get 1512?
explanations.D: The cube of t = 6³ = 216. 1512 ÷ 216 = 7, so we know t³ is multiplied by 7 to get d. The equation is d=7t³

explanations.A: d is directly proportional to t³, not just t, so what is 5³ multiplied by to get 500?
explanations.B: d is directly proportional to t³, so what is 5³ multiplied by to get 500?
explanations.C: The cube of t = 5³ = 125. 500 ÷ 125 = 4, so we know t³ is multiplied by 4 to get d. The equation is d=4t³
explanations.D: d is directly proportional to t³, so what is 5³ multiplied by to get 500?
